codearea.control

Class StyledTextAreaHelper<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • codearea.control.StyledTextAreaHelper<S>

  • public class StyledTextAreaHelper<S>
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a richer set of editing and navigation methods for CodeArea, implemented as thin wrappers around CodeArea's basic methods, such as StyledTextArea.replaceText(int, int, String) or StyledTextArea.selectRange(int, int).

      • appendText

        public void appendText(java.lang.String text)
        Appends a sequence of characters to the content.
        Parameters:
        text - a non null String

      • insertText

        public void insertText(int index,
                       java.lang.String text)
        Inserts a sequence of characters into the content.
        Parameters:
        index - The location to insert the text.
        text - The text to insert.

      • deleteText

        public void deleteText(javafx.scene.control.IndexRange range)
        Removes a range of characters from the content.
        Parameters:
        range - The range of text to delete. The range object must not be null.
        See Also:
        deleteText(int, int)

      • deleteText

        public void deleteText(int start,
                       int end)
        Removes a range of characters from the content.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting index in the range, inclusive. This must be >= 0 and < the end.
        end - The ending index in the range, exclusive. This is one-past the last character to delete (consistent with the String manipulation methods). This must be > the start, and <= the length of the text.

      • cut

        public void cut()
        Transfers the currently selected range in the text to the clipboard, removing the current selection.

      • copy

        public void copy()
        Transfers the currently selected range in the text to the clipboard, leaving the current selection.

      • paste

        public void paste()
        Transfers the contents in the clipboard into this text, replacing the current selection. If there is no selection, the contents in the clipboard is inserted at the current caret position.

      • previousChar

        public void previousChar(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)
        Moves the caret backward one char in the text. Based on the given selection policy, anchor either moves with the caret, stays put, or moves to the former caret position.

      • nextChar

        public void nextChar(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)
        Moves the caret forward one char in the text. Based on the given selection policy, anchor either moves with the caret, stays put, or moves to the former caret position.

      • previousWord

        public void previousWord(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)
        Moves the caret to the beginning of previous word. Based on the given selection policy, anchor either moves with the caret, stays put, or moves to the former caret position.

      • nextWord

        public void nextWord(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)
        Moves the caret to the beginning of next word. Based on the given selection policy, anchor either moves with the caret, stays put, or moves to the former caret position.

      • selectLine

        public void selectLine()

      • lineStart

        public void lineStart(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)

      • lineEnd

        public void lineEnd(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)

        public void start(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)

        public void end(StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)

      • selectAll

        public void selectAll()
        Selects all text in the text input.

      • deletePreviousChar

        public void deletePreviousChar()
        Deletes the character that precedes the current caret position from the text.

      • deleteNextChar

        public void deleteNextChar()
        Deletes the character that follows the current caret position from the text.

      • positionCaret

        public void positionCaret(int pos)

      • positionCaret

        public void positionCaret(int pos,
                          StyledTextAreaHelper.SelectionPolicy selectionPolicy)
        Positions the caret to the position indicated by pos. Based on the selection policy, the selection is either cleared (i.e. anchor is set to the same position as caret), adjusted (i.e. anchor is not moved at all), or extended (i.e. pos becomes the new caret and, if pos points outside the current selection, the far end of the current selection becomes the anchor.

      • moveSelectedText

        public void moveSelectedText(int pos)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the text.

      • deselect

        public void deselect()
        Clears the selection while keeping the caret position.

      • replaceText

        public void replaceText(java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces the entire text content with the given text.

      • replaceSelection

        public void replaceSelection(java.lang.String replacement)
        Replaces the selection with the given replacement String. If there is no selection, then the replacement text is simply inserted at the current caret position. If there was a selection, then the selection is cleared and the given replacement text is inserted.
